title: Grants 10% real property tax exemption on seasonal residences to members of certain volunteer fire companies and departments on Fire Island
summary: Grants a 10% real property tax exemption on seasonal residences to enrolled members of certain incorporated volunteer fire companies and departments on Fire Island, in the county of Suffolk, who are seasonal residents.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2665

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 28, 2011

       Introduced  by  Sen. JOHNSON -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Local Government

       AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to tax exemptions
         for members of certain volunteer fire  companies  and  departments  on
         Fire Island

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph (a) of subdivision 2 of section 466-c of the real
    2  property tax law, as amended by chapter  9  of  the  laws  of  2004,  is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    (a) the applicant resides in the town which is served by such incorpo-
    5  rated  volunteer  fire company or fire department or incorporated volun-
    6  tary ambulance service; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT ENROLLED MEMBERS OF  THE
    7  KISMET  FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  CHERRY GROVE FIRE DEPARTMENT, DAVIS PARK FIRE
    8  DEPARTMENT, FAIR HARBOR FIRE DEPARTMENT, FIRE ISLAND PINES FIRE  DEPART-
    9  MENT,  OCEAN  BAY  PARK  FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  OCEAN BEACH FIRE DEPARTMENT,
   10  POINT-O-WOODS FIRE COMPANY OR SALTAIRE FIRE DEPARTMENT ON  FIRE  ISLAND,
   11  IN  THE  COUNTY  OF  SUFFOLK,  NEED  ONLY BE A SEASONAL RESIDENT OF SUCH
   12  ISLAND;
   13    S 2. Paragraph (b) of subdivision 2 of section 466-c of the real prop-
   14  erty tax law, as added by chapter 450 of the laws of 2002, is amended to
   15  read as follows:
   16    (b) the property is the primary residence of the applicant;  PROVIDED,
   17  HOWEVER, THAT WITH REGARD TO ENROLLED MEMBERS OF THE KISMET FIRE DEPART-
   18  MENT,  CHERRY  GROVE  FIRE  DEPARTMENT, DAVIS PARK FIRE DEPARTMENT, FAIR
   19  HARBOR FIRE DEPARTMENT, FIRE ISLAND PINES  FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  OCEAN  BAY
   20  PARK  FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  OCEAN BEACH FIRE DEPARTMENT, POINT-O-WOODS FIRE
   21  COMPANY OR SALTAIRE FIRE DEPARTMENT ON FIRE ISLAND, SUCH PROPERTY MAY BE
   22  A SEASONAL RESIDENCE OF THE APPLICANT;
   23    S 3. Subdivision 3 of section 466-c of the real property tax  law,  as
   24  added by chapter 450 of the laws of 2002, is amended to read as follows:

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07171-01-1

       S. 2665                             2

    1    3.  (A) Any enrolled member of an incorporated volunteer fire company,
    2  fire department or incorporated voluntary ambulance service who  accrues
    3  more  than  twenty  years  of  active service and is so certified by the
    4  authority having jurisdiction for the incorporated volunteer fire compa-
    5  ny,  fire  department or incorporated voluntary ambulance service, shall
    6  be granted the ten percent exemption as authorized by this  section  for
    7  the remainder of his or her life as long as his or her primary residence
    8  is  located  within  such a county provided that the governing body of a
    9  city, village, town, county or school district, after a public  hearing,
   10  adopts a local law, ordinance or resolution providing therefor.
   11    (B)  NOTWITHSTANDING  THE PROVISIONS OF PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVI-
   12  SION, ANY ENROLLED MEMBER OF THE KISMET FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  CHERRY  GROVE
   13  FIRE  DEPARTMENT,  DAVIS  PARK FIRE DEPARTMENT, FAIR HARBOR FIRE DEPART-
   14  MENT, FIRE ISLAND PINES FIRE DEPARTMENT, OCEAN BAY PARK FIRE DEPARTMENT,
   15  OCEAN BEACH FIRE DEPARTMENT, POINT-O-WOODS FIRE COMPANY OR SALTAIRE FIRE
   16  DEPARTMENT ON FIRE ISLAND WHO IS A SEASONAL RESIDENT OF SUCH ISLAND  AND
   17  WHO ACCRUES MORE THAN TWENTY YEARS OF ACTIVE SERVICE AND IS SO CERTIFIED
   18  BY  THE  AUTHORITY  HAVING  JURISDICTION  FOR  SUCH FIRE COMPANY OR FIRE
   19  DEPARTMENT, SHALL BE GRANTED THE TEN PERCENT EXEMPTION AS AUTHORIZED  BY
   20  THIS  SECTION  FOR THE REMAINDER OF HIS OR HER LIFE AS LONG AS HE OR SHE
   21  MAINTAINS A SEASONAL RESIDENCE ON FIRE ISLAND  PROVIDED  THAT  THE  TOWN
   22  BOARD  OF THE TOWN OF ISLIP OR BROOKHAVEN, AS APPLICABLE, AFTER A PUBLIC
   23  HEARING, ADOPTS A LOCAL LAW, ORDINANCE OR RESOLUTION PROVIDING THEREFOR.
   24    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
